intro: Strychnos bicirrifera, commonly known as the two-lobed strychnos, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed fruits. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with simple, opposite leaves. Its flowers are usually small and yellowish-green, and it produces toxic seeds that contain alkaloids. Due to its toxic properties, it is often avoided for use in traditional medicine or horticulture.
